content.raw: this call is causing the test to fail on the `gpu-none` job. I think we should change the category of this test if it needs to clear the scene
content.html: this call is causing the test to fail on the gpu-none job. I think we should change the category of this test if it needs to clear the scene

pull_request.title: Don't shut down gazebo when removing a world -> 8

pullrequest.title: Don't shut down gazebo when removing a world -> 8

content.raw:
I've been stress-testing the world_remove test on my desktop, and I found a backtrace after 41 successful runs. I've uploaded it to a gist:

* https://gist.github.com/scpeters/5429a14e236500417de022dde312e0a5

It looks like it fails in [TopicManager::ProcessNodes](https://gist.github.com/scpeters/5429a14e236500417de022dde312e0a5#file-backtrace-txt-L19) while [Scene::Clear](https://gist.github.com/scpeters/5429a14e236500417de022dde312e0a5#file-full_backtrace-txt-L265) is called in a separate thread. Maybe there's a missing mutex lock? I believe I saw the [same failure when reviewing](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2515/dont-shut-down-gazebo-when-removing-a/activity#comment-32815770) `worldless_7`
content.html:
I've been stress-testing the world_remove test on my desktop, and I found a backtrace after 41 successful runs. I've uploaded it to a gist:

  • https://gist.github.com/scpeters/5429a14e236500417de022dde312e0a5

It looks like it fails in TopicManager::ProcessNodes while Scene::Clear is called in a separate thread. Maybe there's a missing mutex lock? I believe I saw the same failure when reviewing worldless_7

pull_request.title: Don't shut down gazebo when removing a world -> 8

pullrequest.title: Don't shut down gazebo when removing a world -> 8

pull_request.title: Don't shut down gazebo when removing a world -> 8

update.description:
Continuing the effort to remove worlds, history:

* Remove blank world: pull request #2220
* Remove world with entities: pull request #2263
* Remove world with joints: pull request #2309

The previous PRs added tests to `INTEGRATION_remove_worlds`. With the help of @caguero, we noticed that Gazebo was being shutdown when the world was removed, which should not happen.

In order to be able to completely remove a world and then load a new one (issue #158), the Server must outlive worlds.

This pull request is mainly about the change in `gazebo/Server.cc` to avoid shutdown. Other changes to support that:

* cleaning up pointers
* cleaning up transport
* Add `sensors::running()`
* considerably speed up world_remove tests: [9.5s](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/761/testReport/(root)/WorldRemoveTest_WorldRemoveTest/) instead of [40s](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/GazeboDefault/job/gazebo-ci-default-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/253/testReport/(root)/WorldRemoveTest_WorldRemoveTest/) and [37s](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/761/testReport/(root)/RemoveJointTypes_WorldRemoveJointsTest/) instead of [2min28s](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/GazeboDefault/job/gazebo-ci-default-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/253/testReport/(root)/RemoveJointTypes_WorldRemoveJointsTest/)


Trusty nvidia is [satisfied](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/761/) (warnings have been fixed in 67c654c)
update.title: Don't shut down gazebo when removing a world -> 8

pullrequest.title: Don't shut down gazebo when removing a world -> 8

content.raw: I'm also adding a `Diagnostics::Fini` function to gazebo7 in pull request #2821. There will be some conflicts if that gets merged forward before this is reviewed, but I think it shouldn't be too hard to resolve them.
content.html: I'm also adding a Diagnostics::Fini function to gazebo7 in pull request #2821. There will be some conflicts if that gets merged forward before this is reviewed, but I think it shouldn't be too hard to resolve them.

pull_request.title: Don't shut down gazebo when removing a world -> 8

update.description:
Continuing the effort to remove worlds, history:

* Remove blank world: pull request #2220
* Remove world with entities: pull request #2263
* Remove world with joints: pull request #2309

The previous PRs added tests to `INTEGRATION_remove_worlds`. With the help of @caguero, we noticed that Gazebo was being shutdown when the world was removed, which should not happen.

In order to be able to completely remove a world and then load a new one (issue #158), the Server must outlive worlds.

This pull request is mainly about the change in `gazebo/Server.cc` to avoid shutdown. Other changes to support that:

* cleaning up pointers
* cleaning up transport
* Add `sensors::running()`
* considerably speed up world_remove tests: [9.5s](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/761/testReport/(root)/WorldRemoveTest_WorldRemoveTest/) instead of [40s](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/GazeboDefault/job/gazebo-ci-default-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/253/testReport/(root)/WorldRemoveTest_WorldRemoveTest/) and [37s](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/761/testReport/(root)/RemoveJointTypes_WorldRemoveJointsTest/) instead of [2min28s](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/GazeboDefault/job/gazebo-ci-default-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/253/testReport/(root)/RemoveJointTypes_WorldRemoveJointsTest/)


Trusty nvidia is [satisfied](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/761/) (warnings have been fixed in 67c654c)

content.raw: The tests [pass](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/824/) on the Trusty job on Jenkins but fail for me locally. They were passing for me on Trusty too, but started failing once I switched to Xenial. I wonder if this is an ogre version thing with SkyX
content.html: The tests pass on the Trusty job on Jenkins but fail for me locally. They were passing for me on Trusty too, but started failing once I switched to Xenial. I wonder if this is an ogre version thing with SkyX

pull_request.title: Don't shut down gazebo when removing a world -> 8

pullrequest.title: Don't shut down gazebo when removing a world -> 8

content.raw:
Yes, it started happening to me too. I prevented the segfault by avoiding deleting the sky for now: 7bd5bf5. I disabled it only for server scenes...

After a bit of digging, I couldn't get a clue for the reason of the crash.
content.html:
Yes, it started happening to me too. I prevented the segfault by avoiding deleting the sky for now: 7bd5bf5. I disabled it only for server scenes...

After a bit of digging, I couldn't get a clue for the reason of the crash.

* Remove world with joints: pull request #2309

The previous PRs added tests to `INTEGRATION_remove_worlds`. With the help of @caguero, we noticed that Gazebo was being shutdown when the world was removed, which should not happen.

In order to be able to completely remove a world and then load a new one (issue #158), the Server must outlive worlds.

This pull request is mainly about the change in `gazebo/Server.cc` to avoid shutdown. Other changes to support that:

* cleaning up pointers
* cleaning up transport
* Add `sensors::running()`
* considerably speed up world_remove tests: [9.5s](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/761/testReport/(root)/WorldRemoveTest_WorldRemoveTest/) instead of [40s](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/GazeboDefault/job/gazebo-ci-default-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/253/testReport/(root)/WorldRemoveTest_WorldRemoveTest/) and [37s](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/761/testReport/(root)/RemoveJointTypes_WorldRemoveJointsTest/) instead of [2min28s](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/GazeboDefault/job/gazebo-ci-default-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/253/testReport/(root)/RemoveJointTypes_WorldRemoveJointsTest/)


Trusty nvidia is [satisfied](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/761/) (warnings have been fixed in 67c654c)

content.raw: I'm backporting it now, but I'll leave this pull request here since they will be quite different from each other, so merging the one for gazebo7 forward would be non trivial.
content.html: I'm backporting it now, but I'll leave this pull request here since they will be quite different from each other, so merging the one for gazebo7 forward would be non trivial.

content.raw: True, I suspect this one breaks ABI. I'll check whether this can be backported.
content.html: True, I suspect this one breaks ABI. I'll check whether this can be backported.

pullrequest.title: Don't shut down gazebo when removing a world -> 8

content.raw: The prior pull requests were targeted at gazebo7, but this is targeting default. That's fine with me, but I just wanted to check that was intentional.
content.html: The prior pull requests were targeted at gazebo7, but this is targeting default. That's fine with me, but I just wanted to check that was intentional.

pull_request.title: Don't shut down gazebo when removing a world -> 8

update.description:
Continuing the effort to remove worlds, history:

* Remove blank world: pull request #2220
* Remove world with entities: pull request #2263
* Remove world with joints: pull request #2309

The previous PRs added tests to `INTEGRATION_remove_worlds`. With the help of @caguero, we noticed that Gazebo was being shutdown when the world was removed, which should not happen.

In order to be able to completely remove a world and then load a new one (issue #158), the Server must outlive worlds.

This pull request is mainly about the change in `gazebo/Server.cc` to avoid shutdown. Other changes to support that:

* cleaning up pointers
* cleaning up transport
* Add `sensors::running()`
* considerably speed up world_remove tests: [9.5s](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/761/testReport/(root)/WorldRemoveTest_WorldRemoveTest/) instead of [40s](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/GazeboDefault/job/gazebo-ci-default-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/253/testReport/(root)/WorldRemoveTest_WorldRemoveTest/) and [37s](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/761/testReport/(root)/RemoveJointTypes_WorldRemoveJointsTest/) instead of [2min28s](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/GazeboDefault/job/gazebo-ci-default-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/253/testReport/(root)/RemoveJointTypes_WorldRemoveJointsTest/)


Trusty nvidia is [satisfied](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/761/) (warnings have been fixed in 67c654c)
